meanings.definition: To attract and hold the attention or interest of someone.
meanings.sent1: The colorful illustrations in the book captivates young readers.
meanings.sent2: The magician's performance captivates the audience with its mystery and wonder.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy captivates everyone with its adorable antics.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song captivates the listener like a gentle embrace.
meanings.sent5: The breathtaking view from the mountaintop captivates all who behold it.

meanings.sent1: Her smile captivates everyone she meets.
meanings.sent2: The old castle captivates visitors with its history and grandeur.
meanings.sent3: The sweet aroma of freshly baked cookies captivates the senses.
meanings.sent4: The starlit sky captivates the imagination with its endless possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The graceful dance captivates the audience with its beauty and grace.

meanings.definition: To hold someone captive or spellbound.
meanings.sent1: The evil sorcerer captivates the princess in his dark castle.
meanings.sent2: The suspenseful movie captivates viewers until the very end.
meanings.sent3: The thrilling novel captivates readers with its twists and turns.
meanings.sent4: The haunting melody captivates the ghostly figure in the attic.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious stranger captivates the townspeople with his enigmatic presence.
